Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

This week, the Trump administration deported an Iranian student with a valid visa – despite a court order prohibiting his removal. Since August of last year, at least 10 Iranian students have been denied entry, with seven of those travelling through Boston Logan Airport.

This isn't the first time Massachusetts has been used as a proving ground for the Trump administration's unlawful immigration policies. In 2017, Logan Airport was a site of chaos as customs officials tried to enforce the Muslim ban, flouting court orders telling them to stop.

Today, lawmakers are holding a hearing on the Safe Communities Act, a bill that would establish a set of baseline protections for immigrants – something that Massachusetts has utterly failed to provide.

Tell lawmakers that they need to take action and stand up to this cruel administration – not sit on the sidelines.

Our state and local law enforcement should play no role in the federal deportation dragnet that targets workers, children, students, and families with impunity. Trump's policies make our state a cruel and unwelcoming place, and we cannot afford to be complicit.

I was there at Logan in 2017 and again this week, supporting that young student. I'm sick of seeing this administration trample on basic rights in our own backyard. Today, I'll be on Beacon Hill testifying in support of immigrant families in the Commonwealth, and I hope you'll add your voice to our call for basic decency.

In solidarity,

Carol Rose
Executive Director, ACLU of Massachusetts
